name: AI Tools & Intentional Learning
description: You've now written code from scratch, debugged your own errors, and built a working API. That struggle was intentional—it built mental models you can't get any other way. Now you're ready to use AI tools effectively. The difference between a beginner who uses Copilot and an experienced dev who uses Copilot is massive: the experienced dev knows when Copilot is wrong, when to reject suggestions, and how to guide it. This phase teaches you to use AI as a learning accelerator, not a crutch.
short_description: Learn to use AI tools effectively: GitHub Copilot, prompt engineering, and AI-assisted learning. Improve your Phase 2 capstone with better prompts.
additional_context: This phase is about developing discipline with AI tools. You'll use them to deepen your understanding—not to skip learning. The goal is to become a developer who can leverage AI while maintaining critical thinking and code ownership.
prerequisites: Your Journal API project from Phase 2
objectives: Understand when and how to use AI coding assistants effectively
Learn GitHub Copilot setup and best practices
Master prompt engineering patterns for consistent results
Use AI to deepen understanding, not replace thinking
Improve your Phase 2 capstone with better prompts and system messages

capstone.title: Improve Your Journal API
capstone.summary: Revisit your Phase 2 Journal API and improve it using prompt engineering and AI-assisted review — without outsourcing your understanding.
includes: Review and improve your LLM prompts and system messages
Use Copilot for targeted code review and refactoring
Document what changed and what you learned

hands_on_verification.summary: Demonstrate that you can use AI tools intentionally and communicate your work clearly.
includes: Create a repository demonstrating GitHub Copilot usage
Include documented examples of AI-assisted coding and your decisions

warning: The goal of this phase is NOT to have AI write code for you. It's to learn how to use AI tools as a multiplier for your existing skills. If you find yourself accepting suggestions without understanding them, stop and reconsider. AI should help you learn faster, not skip learning entirely.
